stream_context.summary: Kaze is grey-boxing and coding the “Snowman Cave” portion of Course 11, iterating on platforming geometry, enemy behavior and an elevator set-piece while live-testing on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Shadows will become a stand-alone object so they can search for the correct floor independently from Mario and avoid the current ‘elevator’ bug.
development_findings.quote: My idea for the shadows is that it's actually going to be a whole separate object, separate from Mario. That way it will be all fine.

development_findings.summary: Current goal is a four-room Snowman Cave: 1) upward slide while snowmen attack, 2) void-platform section, 3) cliff-climb, 4) downward slide into a treasure room with coins and the star.
Elevator now physically moves the player instead of teleporting; Kaze tuned camera shake (removed FOV shake, lowered magnitude) for comfort.
development_findings.quote: Maybe the FOV shake is too much… let me remove the FOV shake.

development_findings.summary: Oily-water pits bounce Mario back up and deal damage; needs a unique sound effect and clearer visual cue.
development_findings.quote: If you fall down in an oil rig, you just kind of get lifted back up and you lose some health… there should probably be a sound too.

development_findings.summary: Anti-aliasing and ‘n-prim’ pipeline mode are implemented; yields ~1 FPS on console but still has blur issues that need polish.
development_findings.quote: As long as you do your pipe syncs correctly, you should be able to just use n-prim… it was like 1 FPS or so.

development_findings.summary: Kaze insists on staying within original N64 limits (≤64 MB ROM, no modern hardware assists) to preserve the design challenge.
development_findings.quote: If I don't stay within the original limitations, am I not kind of cheating?

development_findings.summary: After ‘ESO’ is finished he plans an open-source repo to port RTY optimisations back into vanilla SM64.
development_findings.quote: After ESO is done, I'll likely start an open source project… everyone can contribute.

development_findings.summary: Public demo of Course 1 is targeted soon after July 27 (post-F3); feedback will be gathered via a Google Doc focusing on physics and camera feel.
development_findings.quote: I’m gonna have a Google document where people can answer all kinds of questions about what they think of different parts of the physics and stuff.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s first child is due in five days; streams may pause during the birth window.
context_findings.quote: In five days, my daughter is likely going to be born, meaning I might not be able to stream next week.

context_findings.summary: Nintendo has issued roughly 70 takedowns against his channel, reinforcing his caution about legal exposure.
context_findings.quote: They took down 70 of my videos, just so you are aware of how much they hate me.

context_findings.summary: He feels mentally foggy after a week of daily swimming with Zeina, highlighting fatigue alongside development.
context_findings.quote: We went swimming so much this week… maybe that's why I'm feeling so tired today.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on boredom: believes creators need quiet time and laments constant distraction in modern life.
context_findings.quote: People don't enjoy being bored enough; they don't appreciate the value that comes out of just being bored sometimes.

biobak.summary: Reviews every finished model and ‘makes it look a lot better’, also offers feedback on shadow bugs.
biobak.quote: Whenever I'm done with a model, Biobak looks over it again and makes it look a lot better.

badub.summary: Composes the soundtrack and was referenced regarding elevator music and general OST progress.

zeina.summary: Primary animator and concept artist; also manages some stream assets and is days away from giving birth.
zeina.quote: Yeah, animations are the biggest one she's doing.

key_stories.title: Designing the Snowman Cave
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstorms a multi-section ice level live, debating enemy placement, void platforms and slides. He prototypes geometry, tests on real hardware and refines camera shake.
key_stories.challenge: Create a memorable, snowman-themed cave that provides varied platforming without visual clutter.
key_stories.process: Grey-boxed rooms, implemented attacking snowmen, tuned elevator physics and brainstormed visual references (real ice caves, Metroid Prime, Aurora Ice Palace).
key_stories.outcome: Settled on a four-room layout and clear next task (the large downward slide); visuals to be polished later.
key_stories.key_quote: We gotta think about rooms for the snowman cave… can we do more than that?

key_stories.title: Taming the Elevator Shake
key_stories.summary: Initial elevator effect caused excessive screen and FOV shaking, confusing testers. Kaze isolates parameters and iterates to find a subtler motion.
key_stories.process: Reduced magnitude, disabled FOV shake, tested live on console.
key_stories.outcome: Acceptable shake in place; sound still missing.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe the FOV shake is too much… let me remove the FOV shake.

key_stories.title: Impending Fatherhood vs. Development Schedule
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s daughter is due within a week, potentially halting streams and altering workload.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing project momentum with major life event.
key_stories.outcome: No immediate solution; documentary should revisit post-birth impact.
key_stories.key_quote: If she's a day or two late, we might still be in the hospital, so I might not be able to stream.
